Article Title: Microsoft's new AI model can create video game gameplay
Article Text: Microsoft Research and Xbox game studio Ninja Theory have developed a new artificial intelligence model called Muse that can generate gameplay visuals and predict controller inputs, marking what the company calls a breakthrough in AI for gaming.The model, trained on over one billion images and controller actions from the 2020 game Bleeding Edge, demonstrates an understanding of 3D game worlds and physics while responding to player interactions. Microsoft describes Muse as the first of a new category called World and Human Action Models (WHAM).However, the current prototype has significant limitations, only capable of generating low-resolution gameplay at 300x180 pixels. A real-time demonstration ran at just 10 frames per second, according to Microsoft researchers.Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer suggested the technology could aid in game preservation , potentially allowing classic games to run on modern hardware without requiring the original engine. The company also sees applications in game prototyping and development workflows.Amid industry concerns about AI replacing human developers, particularly following widespread gaming industry layoffs in 2024, Ninja Theory studio head Dom Matthews emphasized that Muse isn't intended for content creation. "The interesting aspect for us is how can we use technology like this to make the process of making games quicker and easier for our talented team," Matthews said.Microsoft plans to make some interactive AI gaming experiences available through Copilot Labs, though no specific timeline was given. The company stated that individual Xbox studios will have autonomy in deciding how to implement generative AI technologies in their projects.
Article Summary: Microsoft Research and Xbox game studio Ninja Theory have developed a new artificial intelligence model called Muse. The model can generate gameplay visuals and predict controller inputs, marking what the company calls a breakthrough in AI for gaming. Microsoft describes Muse as the first of a new category called World and Human Action Models (WHAM)

Article Title: Zerodha founder Nikhil Kamath: ‘…we don’t have restaurant brands that…’
Article Text:
Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath

Nikhil Kamath’s post ignite discussions

Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath recently ignited discussions on changing food consumption habits after sharing insights from his trip to Singapore. Taking to microblogging platform X (formerly Twitter), Kamath observed that home cooking is nearly absent in Singapore, with many residents either not having kitchens or rarely using them. In the post, Kamath speculated that if India were to shift towards a more dining-out culture, the restaurant industry could see unprecedented growth. However, he noted a key challenge—India currently lacks large-scale restaurant brands comparable to those in Southeast Asia.“I was in Singapore this week; most I met said they never cook at home, and others don't have a kitchen,” he wrote in the post. “If India were to follow this trend, investing in or opening restaurants would be a massive opportunity, but we don’t have restaurant brands that have close to the scale Southeast Asian chains do,” Kamath remarked.He also pointed out that India’s food service sector remains underdeveloped, with only 30% of the market being organized, compared to 55% in the United States.Citing data from Swiggy and Bain & Company, Kamath highlighted India’s significantly lower consumption of non-home-cooked meals in comparison to other nations. According to data from 2023, the average number of such meals per person is 33 in China, 27 in the United States, 19 in Singapore, 14 in South Korea, and just 5 in India.Kamath’s post stirred an online debate, with users reacting in various ways. One user commented “Every culture is different. Indians love eating meals cooked by themselves, their mom, spouses etc. Moreover Home cooked food is best food your health and mind. Changing this whole and outsourcing it, will definitely boom two industries at scale - restaurants and hospitals”. Another said “Ghar ka khana (home food) is an integral part of Indian culture, and I don’t think that will change anytime soon.”While a third user wrote “The convenience of restaurant dining and food delivery will definitely grow, but home-cooked meals will always be a part of Indian life”. “Wouldn’t a lot of it have to do with price sensitivity & ease of access as well? Indians have a higher probability of ordering in through digital platforms (as compared to eating out / takeaway) but if platforms charge higher rates, they’d rather prefer home cooked food,” said a fourth.

Kamath observed that home cooking is nearly absent in Singapore, with many residents either not having kitchens or rarely using them. He speculated that if India were to shift towards a more dining-out culture, the restaurant industry could see unprecedented growth.

Instagram has rolled out a series of new features for its direct messages (DMs), making its messaging system more competitive with other popular apps like Apple's iMessage. These upgrades aim to enhance user experience by introducing tools for music-sharing, message scheduling, translation, and more.One of the most anticipated additions is the music-sharing feature, which allows users to share 30-second previews of songs from Instagram's music library directly within their DMs. This feature is expected to appeal particularly to younger users who often discover new music through social apps like Instagram and TikTok. To use this feature, users can tap on the sticker button in the chat composer screen, select "Music," and then search for and share their chosen song.Instagram has also introduced a message scheduling feature, enabling users to schedule messages up to 29 days in advance. This feature is similar to Apple's "Send Later" option in iMessage and can be accessed by long-pressing the "send" button and selecting the desired date and time for the message to be sent.The new translation tool allows users to translate messages sent or received in another language, supporting 99 different languages at launch. This feature can be accessed by hard-pressing on the message to be translated and selecting the "translate" option.Users can now pin up to three messages, images, memes, or reels to the top of their chat by holding down on the message and tapping "Pin." This feature is useful for keeping important information within easy reach or for fun purposes. To unpin a message, users can simply tap on the pinned message and select "Unpin”.Another addition is the ability to invite friends to a group chat by sending them a QR code. Users can generate a QR code from the invite link in a chat and share it live, through the built-in share sheet, or save it as an image for later use.These new features are initially available to both iOS and Android users, with web access expected to arrive later.
Article Summary: Instagram has rolled out a series of new features for its direct messages (DMs) These upgrades aim to enhance user experience by introducing tools for music- sharing, message scheduling, translation, and more. Article Title: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath want you to know this about SEBI’s new circular on API usage and algorithmic trading
Article Text:
Take a look at the post here



“The SEBI circular on

API usage

and algo trading is out. What you need to know:

If you’re a retail trader using broker APIs to automate trades, you can do so as long as your order frequency is below an exchange-prescribed threshold. This limit is yet to be decided.

If you’re selling algos or strategies to other traders, you’ll need to partner with a broker and get yourself registered with the exchanges to do so.

Marketplaces, where people share algos for a fee, can’t publish strategies without exchange registration as well as an RA license.

The exchanges will publish their own circulars with operational details by April 1.”

SEBI's latest ALGO trading rules | The Daily Brief #163

What SEBI’s new algo trading rules say



Zerodha co-founder and CEO Nithin Kamath is helping traders understand the Securities and Exchange Board of India 's (SEBI) new rules. In a post shared on social media platform X (earlier Twitter), Kamath explained SEBI ’s new regulations concerning algorithmic trading for retail investors, a move that significantly alters market participation. Kamath highlighted that retail traders selling trading strategies or algorithms must now partner with a broker and register with stock exchanges. Furthermore, platforms facilitating the sharing of algorithms for a fee will need both exchange registration and a research analyst (RA) licence.In the X post, Kamath wrote:In the comment section of the post, he also shared the link to an article which explains the latest SEBI algo trading regulations in details.SEBI’s newly announced framework will allow retail investors to engage in algo trading—an opportunity previously limited to institutional players. The move comes in response to rising demand from retail participants and aims to strike a balance between accessibility and risk management.Under the updated regulations, brokers must secure exchange approval for each algorithm and ensure that all automated orders include a unique identifier for audit tracking. Any modifications to an approved algorithm will also require regulatory clearance. Retail investors developing their algorithms will only need to register them if their order execution frequency exceeds a specified threshold.SEBI has categorised algorithms into two types: “white box” algos, where the logic is transparent and replicable, and “black box” algos, which operate without disclosure. Providers of black box algos will be required to obtain a Research Analyst (RA) license and maintain detailed research documentation.Set to take effect on August 1, these new rules are expected to transform India’s algo trading landscape—expanding automation for retail traders while introducing stricter compliance measures to uphold market integrity .

Article Title: SEBI fines the 'She Wolf of Stock Market': Gave anauthorised ...
Article Text:
SEBI’’s action against Asmita Patel

Asmita Patel accused of re-routing money

Securities & Exchange Board of India ( SEBI ) has seized Rs 53.67 crore from Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd along with five other entities. Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd is a well-known stock market training institute that offers online courses on stocks and trading. Some of the popular courses offered by the self-proclaimed "options queen" and "She Wolf of Stock Market" are "Let's Make India Trade" (LMIT), "Master's in Price Action Trading" (MPAT), and "Options Multiplier" (OM) .Jayesh Thakkar, a SEBI Registered Research Analyst shared a post on X (formerly Twitter) stating “SEBI has seized Rs 53.67 crore that Asmita Patel and five other related entities made illegally. Asmita Patel is also at risk of losing another Rs 104.6 crore it collected from course fees, which SEBI believes were part of unregistered advisory services.”The investigation was initiated by SEBI after receiving complaints from 42 participants of these courses. In addition to impounding the Rs 53.67 crore, SEBI has issued a show-cause notice questioning why Rs 104.6 crore, collected as fees for various programs, should not also be seized.SEBI has sent an interim order directing the school, Asmita Jitesh Patel, and Jitesh Jethalal Patel to cease offering unregistered investment advisory and research analyst services. The entities have also been barred from accessing the securities market.The order also uncovered that fees collected from participants were routed through entities such as King Traders (proprietor: Sagar Dhanjibhai), Gemini Enterprise (proprietor: Suresh Parmashivam), and United Enterprises (proprietor: Jigar Rameshbhai Dawada). SEBI stated that this was a regular practice and not an isolated incident, making all six entities jointly and severally liable for the Rs 53.67 crore earned from course fees.The regulator further demanded that the notices explain why they should not be ordered to disgorge Rs 104.6 crore, along with interest. SEBI's order noted that the fees collected for LMIT, MPAT, and OM courses, as well as other programs provided by the school, were earned under the guise of unregistered advisory and research analyst services.The order reads, “The aforesaid amount includes not only the amount collected as fees by the Noticees for LMIT, MPAT and Options Multiplier (OM) courses but also includes the fees collected by the Noticees for the other courses offered by the Noticee no.1 (Asmita Patel Global School of Trading )through which it carried out unregistered investment advisory and research analyst services along with interest”.Kamlesh Varshney, SEBI's Whole-Time Member, highlighted in the order “Examination revealed that, prima facie, the Noticee no. 1 (Asmita Patel Global School of Trading) along with the Noticee no.2 (Asmita Jitesh Patel) and the Notice no.3 (Jitesh Jethalal Patel) devised a scheme wherein students/investors/participants were lured to trade in specific stocks and told to open trading account with ABC Ltd. Recommendations of buy/sell of specific securities were provided and uploaded on telegram channels owned by the Noticee no.1. The acts of the Noticee no.1 makes it evident that it was providing investment advice/ research analyst services to students/investors/participants for a consideration in the pretext of imparting education.”
Article Summary: Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd is a well-known stock market training institute that offers online courses on stocks and trading. Some of the popular courses offered by the self-proclaimed "options queen" and "She Wolf of Stock Market" are "Let's Make India Trade" (LMIT), "Master's in Price Action Trading" (MPAT), and " options Multiplier" (OM)

Article Title: South Korea finds a 'Tiktok connection' in DeepSeek, and the country is not happy with it
Article Text: In a recent development, South Korea's data protection regulator has discovered a connection between the Chinese AI startup DeepSeek and ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok. This revelation has sparked significant concern among South Korean authorities and the public, leading to immediate regulatory actions.As per a report by Yonhap News Agency, the Personal Information Protection Commission (PIPC) confirmed that DeepSeek, known for its advanced chatbot technology, has been sharing user data with ByteDance. This connection was identified through DeepSeek's use of ByteDance's cloud service, Volcano Engine, which facilitated the data transfer.The PIPC has temporarily suspended new downloads of the DeepSeek app in South Korea, citing concerns over its data collection practices. The regulator has also issued a formal inquiry to DeepSeek, seeking clarification on its data management methods and the extent of data shared with ByteDance.DeepSeek has acknowledged shortcomings in its compliance with South Korean data protection laws and has expressed its willingness to cooperate with the PIPC to address these issues. Article Title: The 'big why' of Gold reserves worth $425 billion that Elon Musk is looking for at 'military installation' in the US

How Elon Musk's Gold chase started



Gold and 'no-entry' board at Fort Knox

As to the value of the Gold, it is said to be worth $425 billion.As to those unaware what Fort Knox is? Fort Knox is the most famous repository for Gold in the US. Other than Fort Know, vast quantities of Gold are also reported to be held at mints in West Point, Denver and at the Federal Reserve vault in New York.According to reports, the Gold audit chatter/demand started after Elon Musk replied to a post from Alex Jones about Fort Knox’s “missing gold” by saying, “It would be cool to do a live video walkthrough of Fort Knox!”This kind of started the Gold frenzy. "As a U.S. senator I’ve tried repeatedly to get into Fort Knox Fort Knox: “You can’t come to Fort Knox.” Me: “Why?” Fort Knox: “It’s a military installation.” Me: “I’m a senator; I go to military bases all the time.” Fort Knox: “You still can’t come. Article Title: Google pays Rs 3,000 crore to avoid criminal investigation in Italy
Article Text:
What Italian prosecutors said about Google’s case



Google has agreed to pay €326 million (nearly Rs 3,000 crore) to Italian authorities. With this payment, the tech giant has settled an investigation into alleged unpaid tax claims against the company’s European division. Italian prosecutors, who announced the settlement, have now receommneded that criminal proceedings against Google Ireland Limited be dropped. The investigation focused on Google's alleged failure to declare and pay taxes on income generated in Italy between 2015 and 2019, primarily from advertising sales.In a statement to the news agency AP, Italian prosecutors said that under the greement reached with Google, "the company proceeded to payment of... 326 million euros in taxes, fines and interest, to resolve the outstanding matter with the Italian tax authorities.”Morever, the prosecutors also confirmed that they have filed a request with a judge to dismiss the criminal case.This comes after Italy asked Google to pay 1 billion euros in unpaid taxes and penalties, seven years after the company settled a major tax dispute with the country’s authorities. In 2017, Google settled a previous case by paying 306 million euros after it was determined to have a permanent presence in Italy.EU’s effort to make US tech companies to pay more taxesThe EU has struggled to make tech companies pay higher taxes in Europe, as many are accused of shifting profits to low-tax countries like Ireland and Luxembourg.One of the most high-profile cases came in 2016 when the European Commission ordered Apple to pay Ireland 13 billion euros in back taxes, ruling that its tax deal with the government was illegal.However, EU judges later overturned the decision, citing a lack of evidence that Apple had violated the rules—a ruling the commission has been trying to challenge ever since.Similarly, the commission is also attempting to reverse another court defeat after judges nullified its order for Amazon to repay 250 million euros in back taxes to Luxembourg.
Article Summary: Google has agreed to pay €326 million (nearly Rs 3,000 crore) to Italian authorities. With this payment, the tech giant has settled an investigation into alleged unpaid tax claims against the company’s European division. Italian prosecutors, who announced the settlement, have now receommned that criminal proceedings against Google Ireland Limited be dropped.

Article Title: Uber is changing its “Auto” model: What this means for users
Article Text:
What is changing and what it means for users

Uber has announced a significant shift in its auto rickshaw service, moving to a software-as-a-service (SaaS) model, essentially changing how riders book and pay for auto rides. The change is now reflecting in the app.Under the new system, Uber connects riders with nearby drivers, but the service operates independently of Uber's core platform. Riders will now pay drivers directly in cash or via UPI.Notably, digital payment methods integrated into the Uber app, including Uber credits and promotions, will no longer be accepted for auto trips. Riders are advised to disable Uber credits before booking an auto.Furthermore, Uber will not charge drivers a commission for auto trips, and the company will not levy cancellation charges. While Uber suggests a fare, the final amount is determined through an agreement between the rider and driver.This means that Uber will not be involved in fare disputes, advising riders to resolve such issues directly with the driver. However, Uber emphasises its commitment to safety and encourages riders to report any safety concerns through the app.Additionally, it should be noted that since Uber only suggests a fare, the company will not offer credits or refunds for auto trips, including those related to fare disputes. No GST will be applied to auto trips, and Uber will not provide tax invoices.Riders can use the fare suggestion receipt from Uber for reimbursement purposes if necessary.If riders encounter errors while booking, they are advised to select cash as the payment method and ensure that “Uber balances” are turned off. This new model aims to give 100% of the fare directly to the drivers.
Article Summary: Uber is moving to a software-as-a-service (SaaS) model. Riders will now pay drivers directly in cash or via UPI. Digital payment methods, including Uber credits, will no longer be accepted. Uber will not charge drivers a commission for auto trips.

Article Title: US President Donald Trump proposes tariffs that may change the shape of the chip industry forever
Article Text: US President Donald Trump has announced plans to impose tariffs of "25% or higher" on imported semiconductor chips , just weeks after returning to office. Speaking at his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida, Trump said that the semiconductor tariffs would increase "substantially" over the course of a year, part of a broader strategy to pressure foreign manufacturers to relocate production to the United States . The move could dramatically reshape the global chip industry , which is critical to products ranging from smartphones to automobiles."When they come into the United States, and they have their plant or factory here, there is no tariff," Trump explained, indicating the escalating duties are designed to incentivize domestic semiconductor manufacturing.The semiconductor tariff announcement came alongside similar threats of 25% duties on imported automobiles and pharmaceuticals. Trump said he would provide chip and drug makers time to establish US factories to avoid the tariffs, though he did not specify a timeline for implementing the semiconductor duties.The announcement follows a series of aggressive trade measures by the Trump administration since taking office last month, including a 10% tariff on Chinese imports and planned 25% duties on steel and aluminum imports set to take effect March 12.Economists warn the mounting tariffs could drive up costs for US consumers and businesses, as import duties are typically paid by American importers rather than foreign exporters. The semiconductor industry is particularly vulnerable to trade disruptions given its complex global supply chains and heavy reliance on international manufacturing.Trump said he expects "some of the biggest companies in the world" to announce new US investments in coming weeks, though he provided no specific details.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump announced plans to impose tariffs of "25% or higher" on imported semiconductor chips. The move could dramatically reshape the global chip industry, which is critical to products ranging from smartphones to automobiles. Trump said he would provide chip and drug makers time to establish US factories to avoid the tariffs.

Article Title: After Facebook and Instagram, WhatsApp may also face EU's strict DSA rules
Article Text: Meta 's messaging platform WhatsApp has crossed a crucial user threshold that will likely subject it to more stringent European Union regulations , according to EU officials and company filings.WhatsApp's channels feature averaged approximately 46.8 million monthly users in the European Union during the second half of 2024, exceeding the 45 million user threshold that triggers designation as a Very Large Online Platform (VLOP) under the Digital Services Act (DSA)."WhatsApp has published user numbers above the threshold for designation as a Very Large Online Platform under the Digital Services Act," European Commission spokesperson Thomas Regnier confirmed Tuesday.The designation would require WhatsApp to implement stronger content moderation measures and conduct risk assessments regarding the spread of illegal or harmful content. Companies designated as VLOPs must also provide users with greater control over their data and the ability to opt out of recommendation systems and profiling.The European Commission still needs to formally classify WhatsApp as a VLOP before the new requirements take effect. Under DSA regulations, companies face fines of up to 6% of their annual global revenue for non-compliance.The milestone applies specifically to WhatsApp's channels feature, which allows news outlets and public figures to broadcast content to followers. Regular private messaging activity does not count toward the VLOP designation.Meta, WhatsApp's parent company, did not respond to requests for comment. The company's other major platforms, Facebook and Instagram, are already regulated as VLOPs in the European Union.The development comes amid increasing EU scrutiny of social media platforms, which has drawn criticism from US officials including Vice President JD Vance, who recently condemned European efforts to regulate online speech.
Article Summary: WhatsApp's channels feature averaged approximately 46.8 million monthly users in the European Union during the second half of 2024. That exceeds the 45 million user threshold that triggers designation as a Very Large Online Platform (VLOP) The European Commission still needs to formally classify WhatsApp as a VLOP before the new requirements take effect.
